snippet: States were expected to spend only $481 million on programs intended to prevent or curb tobacco use, well below the $3.7 billion recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, a report said.
abstract: Alliance of advocacy groups issues report finding that only two states are poised to meet federal recommendations for tobacco prevention spending in 2014, despite billions of dollars nationwide from tobacco taxes and settlements.
lead_paragraph: States were expected to spend only $481 million on programs intended to prevent or curb tobacco use, well below the $3.7 billion recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, a report said.

headline.main: States Found to Shift Funds From Antismoking Efforts
headline.print_headline: States Found to Shift Funds From Antismoking Efforts

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
